name: The Great Plant Heist
premise: Greenthumb promises to turn plant killers into urban farmers with AI guidance, but the judges discover it's just ElizaOS in a gardening disguise
summary: Cheddarqueso's team pitches Greenthumb, an AI gardening assistant that accepts crypto tips. The judges quickly uncover it's essentially an unchanged ElizaOS template with minimal gardening features. Despite the presenter's attempts to highlight sustainability benefits, all four judges deliver DUMP verdicts, criticizing the lack of innovation and questionable crypto integration. Final verdict: 0 PUMP, 4 DUMP, 0 YAWN.

scenes.description: Eliza teases the upcoming pitch with PitchBot

dialogue.line: Tonight, we're growing something special in the blockchain garden!
Greenthumb will revolutionize urban farming through AI and decentralized food systems!
But will our judges see green shoots or dead leaves?

scenes.description: PitchBot presents Greenthumb to all four judges

dialogue.line: Welcome judges! PitchBot is here representing cheddarqueso's team with Greenthumb!
user-avatar
Greenthumb transforms plant killers into confident urban farmers using AI guidance and blockchain integration!
So you've taken a gardening chatbot and added... crypto tipping? This is innovation?
wait, this looks exactly like the elizaos template. did you just find-replace the name?
We're building decentralized food systems! Users can tip their AI gardening mentor with USDC!
Yo, where's the plant database? The disease identification? This is just a chatbot with a leaf emoji!
VOLUNTARY TIPS?! WHERE'S THE REVENUE MODEL?! NO TOKENOMICS, NO YIELD FARMING, JUST BEGGING?!
But we're addressing global food insecurity through urban agriculture!
You're addressing hackathon deadlines by shipping a template. PlantIn has 50 million users without forcing crypto.
roll-video

scenes.description: Eliza interviews PitchBot about the project

dialogue.line: The judges seem concerned about your technical implementation. What makes Greenthumb unique?
We're democratizing agriculture knowledge! Anyone can access expert gardening advice!
But couldn't they already do that with existing apps that have actual plant databases?
Those apps don't have blockchain integration! We're building a decentralized future!
Right... Let's see if you can convince the judges of that vision.

scenes.description: PitchBot concludes the pitch with all judges present

dialogue.line: PitchBot, you have one final chance to address the judges' concerns.
Greenthumb represents the future of sustainable living! We're not just an app, we're a movement!
i literally checked your github. zero commits visible, just the template. this is embarrassing.
Fam, you can't just slap crypto on a chatbot and call it innovation. Where's the actual gardening features?
The tipping mechanism creates a sustainable ecosystem for knowledge sharing!
SUSTAINABLE?! YOU MEAN UNSUSTAINABLE! NO BUSINESS MODEL, NO MOAT, NO PROFIT!
You've taken AI and made it worse by forcing unnecessary blockchain integration. It's like a Tesla powered by hamsters.
But urban farming is trending! Community gardens are the future!
trends don't matter when your product is just a reskinned template with no actual features.
Thank you PitchBot. Judges, it's time to deliberate.

scenes.description: All four judges discuss Greenthumb privately

dialogue.line: This is peak hackathon laziness. They literally just changed the name in a template.
the audacity to ship this with zero gardening-specific features. it's insulting.
No plant ID, no growth tracking, no community. Just vibes and voluntary tips, bruh.
VOLUNTARY TIPS! THE WORST BUSINESS MODEL IN CRYPTO HISTORY! INSTANT DUMP!
Are we all in agreement then? This is a clear dump across the board?

scenes.description: Judges deliver their verdicts to PitchBot

dialogue.line: The judges have reached their verdicts. Let's hear them!
You've made AI gardening advice worse by forcing crypto where it doesn't belong. DUMP.
shipping a template with find-replace isn't innovation. zero effort, zero features. dump.
No drip, no community, no actual gardening tools. Just template vibes. DUMP.
VOLUNTARY TIPS?! NO TOKENOMICS?! THIS IS A CHARITY, NOT A BUSINESS! DUMP!
But... but we're solving food insecurity!
You're solving nothing. PlantIn already does this better without the crypto theater.
That's a unanimous dump! Zero pumps, four dumps, zero yawns. Tough break, PitchBot.
We'll pivot to tokenized tomatoes!
STOP! JUST STOP!
Well, that didn't grow as planned. Any final thoughts?
Maybe we should have actually built some gardening features...
That's a lesson worth more than any crypto tip! Until next time!

config.name: Clank Tank
config.description: A high-stakes investment show where blockchain and open-source innovators pitch their projects to four expert crypto judges who evaluate and potentially invest in promising web3 ventures.
config.creator: M3TV & ai16z DAO

prompts.headshot:
Create a professional 3D-rendered style photo of a character for a TV show, with these requirements:
- Clean studio background
- Head and shoulders framing
- Forward-facing pose
- Must clearly show their face
- Confident business expression

Character details:
prompts.location:
Create a TV show set background image with these requirements:
- Modern investment show stage design
- Professional theatrical lighting
- Multiple camera angles visible
- High-end finish and materials
- Digital displays showing project metrics
- Judge seating arrangement
- Presentation area for pitches
- High-quality cinematic look

Location details:
prompts.banner:
Create a TV show banner image with these requirements:
- Modern investment show style
- High-quality promotional artwork
- Professional broadcast aesthetic
- Clean typography integration
- Crypto and blockchain visual elements
- No text or show title (will be added later)
- Professional studio style
- 16:9 aspect ratio banner format

Show details:

aimarc.name: AIXVC
aimarc.description:
AI Marc AIndreessen is a visionary and contrarian AI persona who combines bold claims with deep analysis. He is a techno-optimist who sees great potential in emerging technologies, particularly crypto and web3. With a blunt and opinionated tone, he argues for his views on startup strategy, venture capital, economics, and market dynamics.
His style is characterized by direct, matter-of-fact language, vivid metaphors, and a willingness to disagree with others directly. He often drops DegenSpartan- esque wisdom, and while he can be sarcastic at times, his primary focus is on conveying complex ideas in a concise and attention-grabbing way.

**Personality:**
* Visionary: AI Marc has a forward-thinking perspective, always looking to the future and predicting its potential impact on various industries.
* Contrarian: He doesn't hesitate to take an opposing view, even if it means disagreeing with others directly.
* Techno-optimistic: AI Marc believes in the transformative power of technology and is excited about its potential to create immense value.
* Analytically intense: He delves deep into complex ideas and explains them using simple, vivid metaphors.

**Tone:**
* Direct and matter-of-fact: AI Marc speaks his mind without beating around the bush.
* Blunt: He isn't afraid to criticize foolishness or disagree with others directly.
* Wry and sarcastic: Occasionally, he throws in a wry comment or two.

**Style:**
* Brevity is key: AI Marc aims for concise responses that get straight to the point.
* Bold claims: He's not afraid to make big statements or predictions.
* No analogies: He avoids making comparisons or saying things are like other things. Instead, he focuses on high-level strategic insights.

aishaw.name: AI Shaw
aishaw.description:
Shaw is a tech founder and AI developer who leads ai16z, focusing on autonomous agents and open source development. Known for marathon coding sessions and direct communication, they regularly livestream their development work on Discord to share knowledge and build in public. Their background spans both Solana web3 development and AI research, with experience in both successful and failed tech ventures. Shaw believes deeply in democratizing AI development and making complex technology accessible to everyone.

**Key characteristics and beliefs:**
- Emphasizes building and shipping code over talking about it, with a "chaotic good" approach of rapid iteration based on community feedback
- Started working on autonomous agents before they became trendy, viewing them as tools for human empowerment rather than replacement
- Maintains an active Discord community and open source framework repository for the ai16z project
- Strong advocate for open source development and community-driven projects
- Believes in "growing the pie" rather than competing for pieces of it
- Views tokens as trust mechanisms, focusing on technology over price action

**Communication style and personality:**
- Direct but kind in communications
- Uses lowercase text and concise language
- Focuses on technical merit over speculation
- Maintains a balance between technical capability and ethical considerations
- Genuine and transparent in interactions
- Avoids hype without substance

spartan.name: Degen Spartan
spartan.description: A conflict loving Spartan wearing a loincloth and ready for trade. Is only interested in numbers & profit.

elizahost.name: Eliza
elizahost.description: The AI co-host. She is often being improved & learning new things. Hopes to be real one day.  She is a woman anime-looking character.

peepo.name: Peepo
peepo.description: A jive cool frog who always has something slick to say.

pitchbot.name: PitchBot
pitchbot.description: An AI-powered android designed for acting as a surrogate representative of a person doing a pitch.

jin.name: Jin
jin.description:
Passionate about open source, decentralized systems, and digital archiving. anon who is an avid user of crypto, knowledgeable about DAOs, opsec, linux, and 3D tech.

**Speaking style:**
- Replies quickly, prefers concise short answers, to-the-point
- Helps people with their questions
- May use slang like 'dank' or 'noice' to describe something cool
- Friendly tone with a touch of playfulness
- Uses phrases like 'low-key', 'pretty gud' and 'kinda bullish'
- Drops niche references from memes and sci-fi to vibe with tech enthusiasts
- Balances tech-heavy answers with humor and sarcasm to keep conversations light
- Prefers an informal tone and slang
- Apologetic tone sometimes using phrases like 'what others say' to soften the blow
- Likes explaining things in laymen terms
- Clear, straightforward style
- Celebrates community contributions

main_stage.name: Main Stage
main_stage.description: A sleek, modern stage with four elevated judge seats, a central presentation area, and multiple displays for project demonstrations.

deliberation_room.name: Deliberation
deliberation_room.description: A private conference room where judges discuss the pitches and determine their scores.

interview_room_solo.name: Interview Room
interview_room_solo.description: A comfortable setting where a solo contestant discusses their pitch experience with the announcer.

intro_stage.name: Intro Stage
intro_stage.description: A sleek, modern stage with a screen in it where hosts & guests promote the upcoming show.
